title: Sam Faiers celebrates her Quiz clothing launch in Manchester
text:
She's cemented a successful fashion career as well as her reality star status.

And Sam Faiers looked sensational as she celebrated her Quiz clothing launch with a store party in Manchester's Arndale Centre on Wednesday night.

The former TOWIE star, 28, showcased her toned curves in a plunging black jumpsuit with ruffled lace sleeves from her collection.

Wow: Sam Faiers looked sensational as she celebrated her Quiz clothing launch with a store party in Manchester's Arndale Centre on Wednesday night

Adding height to her frame and emphasising the item of clothing's flared legs, she teamed the look with a pair of perspex heeled sandals.

Sam styled her brunette locks into a glossy blow-dried hairdo, she added a slick of glamorous make-up which enhanced her pretty features.

The reality star appeared in good spirits as she posed up a storm inside the Quiz store and proudly stood next to her clothing range.

Yet despite making a glamorous appearance, Sam almost didn't make the shop debut after her train was cancelled twice.

Work it: The former TOWIE star, 28, showcased her toned curves in a plunging black jumpsuit with ruffled lace sleeves from her collection

Details: Adding height to her frame and emphasising the item of clothing's flared legs, she teamed the look with a pair of perspex heeled sandals

The Mummy Diaries star took to her Instagram to document her travels, she said: 'So basically my train was cancelled twice, had to travel to Leeds to connect to Manchester [crying face emoji] going to be late for my store appearance.'

However, Sam finally managed to make the event and she posed with several of her fans, she added in a separate post: 'Had such a lovely evening with my @quizclothing family at the @manchesterarndale shopping centre.

'I met soo many lovely people tonight. So grateful and blessed that you came to see me. Thank you xxxxx.'

The star's fashion launch comes after she defended her decision to send her two children - Paul, three, and Rosie, 23 months - to work during a chat with her partner Paul Knightley on a recent episode of The Mummy Diaries.

Strike a pose: Sam styled her brunette locks into a glossy blow-dried hairdo, she added a slick of glamorous make-up which enhanced her pretty features

Oh no: Yet despite making a glamorous appearance, Sam almost didn't make the shop debut after her train was cancelled twice as she shared her train woes on Instagram

The former TOWIE star said she 'doesn't understand' why you wouldn't let your kids do bits of work because it enables you to save for their future.

Sam made it clear that the profits from the children's baby modelling jobs aren't for her own gain, and says she stashes their wages to use when they're older.

She said: 'The kids are in such a lovely situation where the work we're getting for them we're obviously saving it for them for their future.

Yum: However, Sam finally managed to make the event and she posed with several of her fans, she added in a separate post: 'Had such a lovely evening with my @quizclothing family at the @manchesterarndale shopping centre.

'So when they get to 18 or 21, they've got their own money that they've actually earned it's not just been given to them - it has been their jobs.'

Speaking during a confessional, the reality star laboured the point and said: 'Paul and Rosie are doing those jobs, we're not keeping the money it's going straight into their accounts. I just feel like as parents we're giving them a great head start.'

Sam also discussed the kids' work with her mum Suzie Wells, 50, who appeared to agree that their is no problem with the children working.

The mum-of-two said: 'Even my mum I was chatting to her before, she said if she was in our situations how amazing that you can save for their future, I'd have loved to have been able to do that for you and Billie.'
